intro: Senecio persicus, commonly known as Persian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with tubular central cones surrounded by ray florets. Senecio persicus is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates.
